listDescription: This list contains only RetroList for testing in the production purpose.
impactEvaluationInput: RetroList provides a better ballot voting experience, so I think RetroList should get OP allocated more than the average.
impactEvaluationDescription:
RetroList provides a better ballot voting experience, so I think RetroList should get OP allocated more than the average.

Created by chomtana.town using RetroList with "User and DAO Tooling Rubric" rubric.

6558d9dfe0ded8095db33487.comment: RetroPGF 3 is a critical mission in the Optimism Collective that need a powerful list creation UI

6558d9dfe0ded8095db33488.comment: Likely to continue development for upcoming RetroPGF rounds

projectsMetadata.bio: RetroPGF Rubric-based List Creation UI opening to public crowdsourcing
projectsMetadata.displayName: Retrolist | RetroPGF Rubric-based List Creation UI

rubric.name: User and DAO Tooling Rubric

scores.0: Project is not used by anybody
scores.1: Project is mostly used by only airdrop hunters
scores.2: Project is occasionally used by a few users
scores.3: Project is adopted by a small group of users who drive value to the Optimism ecosystems
scores.4: Project is adopted by a large group of users who drive value to the Optimism ecosystems
scores.5: Project is widely adopted by general public and driving value to the Optimism ecosystems

scores.2: Project solve new problems that are not critical
scores.3: Project solve critical problems but are not demanding in the Optimism Collective
scores.4: Project is a demanding piece in the Optimism collective

scores.1: Mercenary commitment attraction (stays until benefits end)
scores.2: Commitment attraction (1 â€“ 3 months after rewards end)
scores.3: Commitment attraction (1 year after rewards end)
scores.4: Commitment attraction (2+ years after rewards end)

scores.0: There's a clear flaw in the design that cannot be easily remedied
scores.1: Difficult to see the project continuing for more than a year
scores.2: There's a reasonable chance that the project has intermediate-to-long-term success (+1 Year)
scores.3: The project is likely to generate long-term, sustainable value for the Optimism ecosystem
scores.4: The project has a substantial likelihood of generating long-term, sustainable value for the Optimism ecosystem

scores.0: There is little to distinguish this project from other projects that exist on Optimism already
scores.1: This is one of a small number of examples of a project being built on Optimism that is otherwise common throughout Web3
scores.2: This project is distinguishable from other projects in Web3 on the margins (e.g., a different way of doing something that may be done in other contexts already)
scores.3: This project is distinguishable from other projects in Web3: very few other projects are doing something similar and this is not merely a different way of performing an existing operation
scores.4: This project is on the horizon and is meaningfully different from other projects in Web3

scores.0: The team does not substantiate the ability to deliver the project
scores.1: The team does not show significant ability to deliver the project
scores.2: The team shows a significant ability to deliver the project
scores.3: The team shows a significant ability to drive the adoption
scores.4: The team exceeds what is required to drive the adoption

scores.0: This is a multi-chain application that fork across many chains
scores.2: This application is designed exclusively for Optimism (Can be multi-chain but customized specially for Optimism)
Committed to a long-term open-source model

scores.0: Product is working and providing impact
scores.-2: Product is under development but not active
scores.-4: Only demo video or design provided
scores.-5: No development beyond a proposal paper

scores.-3: Project received <= 1M$ in funding or received a seed investment
scores.-4: Project received >1M$ or raised fund beyond seed investment
scores.-5: Project is listed in major exchanges

rubric.description: Rubric for evaluating tooling developed for user and DAO
